message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Competitiveness Index to evaluate the relationship between innovation and firm competitiveness.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Global Competitiveness Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health, National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey, and the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System to investigate the association between food insecurity and chronic disease risk factors.", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health", "National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System"], "topic": ["Health", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a panel dataset of firms in the extractive industries sector in Africa to examine the role of institutional quality and firm size on environmental performance.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of firms in the extractive industries sector in Africa"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from the Mexican Family Life Survey and geographic information system data on vegetation coverage, we assess the impact of deforestation on household welfare in rural Mexico.", "dataset": ["Mexican Family Life Survey"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Millennium Development Goals Impact Evaluation Surveys in Nepal to estimate the impact of a community-driven reconstruction program on social capital and collective action.", "dataset": ["Millennium Development Goals Impact Evaluation Surveys in Nepal"], "topic": ["Governance", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Analysis of annual data on air quality, population density, and vehicle holdings from the World Health Organization and the International Energy Agency shows that transportation emissions are a major contributor to air pollution-related health problems worldwide.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization", "International Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Transport", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a geocoded dataset of conflict events in Syria using information from multiple sources, including the Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project and the Syrian Network for Human Rights.", "dataset": ["Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project", "Syrian Network for Human Rights"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "This paper combines data from the Demographic and Health Survey and the Global Burden of Disease Study to estimate the contribution of dietary risk factors to child malnutrition in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey", "Global Burden of Disease Study"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the International Crisis Group and the World Bank Fragile and Conflict-Affected Situations database to examine the relationship between land tenure security and violence in post-conflict settings.", "dataset": ["International Crisis Group", "World Bank Fragile and Conflict-Affected Situations database"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using an ecologically valid dataset of financial transactions from mobile money agents in Kenya, we investigate the effects of agent incentives and fees on customer adoption and usage behaviors.", "dataset": ["financial transactions from mobile money agents in Kenya"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}]
